questions.question: What is the characteristic bluish-violet discoloration of the vagina and cervix during pregnancy known as?
Which hormone is primarily responsible for maintaining the endometrium and inhibiting uterine contractions during pregnancy?
What is the common term for the irregular, painless uterine contractions that occur during pregnancy?
Morning sickness typically appears and disappears at which weeks of pregnancy?
What is the name of the pigmented line that can appear between the umbilicus and symphysis pubis during pregnancy?
Why does urinary frequency often increase during pregnancy?
options: Pressure from the uterus on the bladder

questions.question: What is the approximate total weight gain recommended during a normal pregnancy?
Which part of the breast becomes darker and more pigmented during pregnancy?
Heartburn during pregnancy is primarily caused by:
What is the primary function of the mucous plug in the cervix during pregnancy?
options: To aid in dilation during labor
To provide a protective barrier between the vagina and uterus

questions.question: The softening of the cervix during pregnancy, which may be observed around the sixth week, is known as:
Until approximately which week does the corpus luteum remain active in maintaining pregnancy?
Which hormone, secreted by the trophoblast, is the basis for most pregnancy tests?
What is the primary reason for physiological anemia during pregnancy?
options: Plasma volume increases more than red blood cell mass
Increased destruction of red blood cells

questions.question: The upward displacement of the appendix during pregnancy is a result of:
options: The growing uterus displacing the stomach and intestines

questions.question: What is the term for the separation of the rectus abdominis muscles during pregnancy?
Which of the following clotting factors shows a marked increase during pregnancy?
Cardiac output during pregnancy increases by approximately:
The increase in tidal volume during pregnancy is approximately:
Glycosuria (glucose in the urine) during pregnancy is often due to:
options: Increased glomerular filtration rate with impaired tubular reabsorption

questions.question: What is the main role of Relaxin during pregnancy?
options: Maintaining myometrial quiescence and ripening the cervix

questions.question: The 'mask of pregnancy' characterized by butterfly pigmentation on the face is called:
Why might a pregnant woman be more susceptible to urinary tract infections?
options: Due to urinary stasis from dilated ureters

questions.question: The enlargement of the thyroid gland during pregnancy is primarily due to:
What causes the sensation of shortness of breath (dyspnea) in the last trimester?
options: Elevation of the diaphragm by the gravid uterus

questions.question: The hormone Human Placental Lactogen (HPL) primarily affects:
options: Maternal metabolism of glucose to favor fetal growth

questions.question: Parathyroid hormone levels increase during pregnancy primarily to:
options: Meet the increased demand for calcium

questions.question: Carpal tunnel syndrome during pregnancy can be caused by:
Which of the following is a key change in adrenal gland function during pregnancy?
The white blood cell count (leukocyte count) during pregnancy and labor:
The term 'destroflexed' and 'destrorotated' for the pregnant uterus refers to its common deviation and rotation towards which side?
The lower uterine segment is formed from the expansion of which anatomical part after 12 weeks of pregnancy?
What is the primary reason for the decrease in total lung capacity during pregnancy?
Maternal hyperventilation during pregnancy leads to:
The conversion of amino acids to urea is inhibited during pregnancy. This is related to changes in which type of metabolism?
Which insulin antagonists are mentioned as causing decreased tissue sensitivity during pregnancy?
The broadening of the thoracic circumference during pregnancy is facilitated by the relaxation of muscles and cartilage under the influence of which hormone?
The supine hypotension syndrome in late pregnancy is primarily due to:
options: Compression of the inferior vena cava by the enlarged uterus

questions.question: A blood pressure reading of what value is considered abnormal during pregnancy?
The increased levels of which adrenal hormone help overcome the salt-wasting effects of progesterone?
Palmar erythema and vascular spiders during pregnancy are attributed to:
Which part of the pituitary gland shows a gradual increase in oxytocin production as the fetus matures?
The alteration in immune function during pregnancy primarily allows for:
options: Acceptance and growth of the fetal foreign tissue

questions.question: What is the primary source of progesterone production after the first trimester (around 10 weeks)?
The characteristic change in the shape of the uterus from an inverted pear to a globular form occurs around which week?
What is the primary cause of the physiological edema often seen in the ankles during pregnancy?
options: Decreased venous return due to vena cava compression

questions.question: The term 'striae albicantes' refers to:
options: The pink lines of striae gravidarum during pregnancy
The pale, silvery-white appearance of striae after delivery
The line of pigmentation on the abdomen

questions.question: The increase in serum alkaline phosphatase during pregnancy is primarily due to:
The resting position of the diaphragm is shifted upwards by approximately how much during pregnancy?
Which hormone is responsible for the softening and relaxation of the pelvic joints during pregnancy?
The 'liability to develop varicose veins' during pregnancy is due to all EXCEPT:
options: Pressure of the gravid uterus on pelvic veins
Relaxation of vessel wall smooth muscle by progesterone

questions.question: The initial creamy, white-to-yellowish pre-milk fluid that can be expressed from the nipples as early as 16 weeks is called:
What is the primary stimulus for the marked increase in cortisol secretion during pregnancy?
The subcostal angle increases from 69° to what approximate value by 37 weeks of pregnancy?
Which of the following is NOT a stated reason for constipation during pregnancy?
options: Relaxation of smooth muscle by progesterone
Increased water reabsorption in the colon

questions.question: The pain of appendicitis during pregnancy may be felt higher than expected because:
options: The appendix becomes inflamed more easily
The growing uterus displaces the appendix upward
Pain perception is altered by hormones
The omentum cannot wall off the infection

questions.question: The development of Montgomery's tubercles is related to the enlargement of which structures?
In which position is the cardiac output lowest for a pregnant woman in late pregnancy?
The term 'pregnancy plea' refers to:
options: Longing for or aversion to certain foods and odors

questions.question: The hypertrophy and hyperplasia of the vaginal epithelium during pregnancy are primarily due to the effects of:
The leukocyte count during labor can normally reach as high as:
What is the primary role of prostaglandins during pregnancy as mentioned in the document?
The 'fiery-red branching spots' on the skin, particularly on the thighs, are called:
The decrease in peripheral resistance that contributes to a potential drop in blood pressure in the second trimester is caused by:
The renal plasma flow rate increases during pregnancy by how much?
The pH of the vaginal environment during pregnancy becomes:
The uterine blood flow at full term increases to approximately:
The hormone responsible for the feeling of increased body heat and sweating during pregnancy is:
The development of the ductal system of the breasts in preparation for lactation is primarily stimulated by:
The weight of the uterus increases from about 50 gm to what approximate weight at term?
The vagina becomes alkaline in pH during pregnancy.
Chadwick's sign refers to the bluish-violet discoloration of the cervix and vagina.
The corpus luteum remains active throughout the entire pregnancy.
Progesterone is the hormone that plays the greatest role in maintaining pregnancy.
Colostrum can be expressed from the nipples as early as 16 weeks of gestation.
Morning sickness occurs in nearly 100% of pregnant women.
Constipation during pregnancy can be caused by progesterone relaxing smooth muscle.
The liver significantly increases in size during pregnancy.
The total lung capacity increases during pregnancy.
Lordosis of pregnancy helps to maintain the center of gravity.
Striae Gravidarum always remain pink after delivery.
The glomerular filtration rate (GFR) decreases during pregnancy.
Blood volume increases by up to 45-50% during pregnancy.
The white blood cell count decreases during pregnancy and labor.
Cardiac output decreases during pregnancy.
Supine hypotension syndrome is caused by compression of the aorta.
Nasal congestion during pregnancy can be a response to increased estrogen levels.
Oxygen consumption decreases during pregnancy.
The anterior lobe of the pituitary gland increases significantly in size during pregnancy.
Insulin production decreases during pregnancy.
Immune function is enhanced during pregnancy to protect against all infections.
The fall in blood pressure during the second trimester is due to decreased peripheral resistance.
The ureters become less dilated during pregnancy.
Palmar erythema is redness and itching on the feet due to increased estrogen.
The basal metabolic rate (BMR) increases by up to 20% in the last trimester.
Prostaglandins play an active role in starting labor.
Relaxin is secreted by the corpus luteum and later by the placenta and myometrium.
The pH of the oral cavity increases during pregnancy, protecting against tooth decay.
The development of diastasis recti is a separation of the oblique muscles.
The term 'lightening' refers to the relief of diaphragmatic pressure before labor.
